blog.name: stevesnightmares
blog.title: "Awake, arise, or be forever fallen."
blog.description: “The question that sometimes drives me hazy: Am I or the others crazy?”

summary: Captain Marvel's trailers negativity: piss off
body:
Captain Marvel’s trailers negativity: piss off

I’m so happy that in the “Connection” TV spot the comments are a lot more positive because tbh I was getting so damn tired of going to the comments section of every Captain Marvel trailer and only seeing negative comments.

There is a big difference between making a negative review of something after you watched it and didn’t enjoy it and just commenting negative shite when you haven’t even watched the movie because it hasn’t come out yet. Bad reviews detailing what you didn’t like about the movie, what could have been done better, the things that you like etc are fine. Even just commenting “I personally didn’t enjoy the movie because it was boring/unoriginal/it was trying to hard etc” it’s still fine. Saying that you know for sure that it’s going to suck before it even comes out it’s just pointless.

Also, I hate how everyone was saying that it’s not fair that she is so overpowered, that she has no weaknesses, that she is going to be part of an Avengers movie even though she has only one movie out and that she is going to defeat Thanos even though she just arrived.

1) We don’t know if she’s overpowered, the movie hasn’t come out yet.

2) WE CAN’T KNOW THIS. THE MOVIE HASN’T COME OUT YET. Because in the trailers for other superheros they immediately showed us their weaknesses? No. It’s a trailer.

3) But nobody said anything when Spiderman was on Civil War when he didn’t have any solo movies out yet. Also, Natasha and Clint didn’t even have solo movies.

4) It seems like a lot of people have already seen Avengers: Endgame or they know what’s going to happen in that movie in advance. Hmmm strange.

And don’t get me started on how everyone is ganging up on Brie saying that she can’t act and has no emotions. The trailers imply that she was brainwashed or something and she was made part of a warrior race (that’s what I gathered, I could be wrong, I don’t know anything about Carol Dancers and I want to keep it that way until I see the movie) so she is supposed to be like that, she is not supposed to show her emotions. In the new trailer we saw more of her personality and I really liked it. Can’t wait for the movie, this new trailer really got me even more excited.

summary: Goose Confirmed to be an Alien in Captain Marvel
title: Goose Confirmed to be an Alien in Captain Marvel
body:
Goose Confirmed to be an Alien in #CaptainMarvel

Readers of Captain Marvel in the comics know how her cat, Chewie, was an alien called a Flerken and not an Earth cat. While it’s been suspected that Goose in the Captain Marvel movie would also be a Flerken, there was no confirmation on that…until now.

Toys of Goose are starting to appear on shelves, and they confirm that the cat is indeed an alien:

We’re about to see #GooseTheCatunleash her…

View On WordPress

blog.name: mrdaps
blog.title: Mr. DAPs
blog.description:
Hi there!

I am Mr. DAPs, that guy with the hat that walks around Disneyland. I will mainly be posting some pictures that I have taken that I particularly like here but will occasionally post some other things.

You can read some of my other posts at any or all of the links below:

Blog: mrdaps.com
Website: dapsmagic.com
Twitter: twitter.com/mrdaps
Facebook: facebook.com/misterdaps

Please feel free to add me on any or all of the above links. I look forward to chatting with you and seeing you in the park!

Make it a GREAT day!

-Mr. DAPs

title: A Magical Nite - DISNEY Reporter
body:
A Magical Nite – DISNEY Reporter

Welcome to another edition of DISNEY Reporter. Each week the top Disney and geek headlines are shared. This week, there was a lot of ground to cover. From the Super Bowl to Disney Parks news, to other entertainment news, there were a lot of things going on from around the Walt Disney Company. Let’s take a look at this week’s headlines!

summary:
I really enjoyed the Captain Marvel website, but I’m just thinking... 
The pound sign was still in use in phones so I want to...
body:
I really enjoyed the Captain Marvel website, but I’m just thinking…

The pound sign was still in use in phones so I want to get snitty and say “ugh, fake 90s kid”

I could have sworn leet didn’t get mainstream until the ‘00s. Does anyone remember when it actually became something the majority of internet folks knew?

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!
